DataElement.preferredName: Personal Medical History Gynecologic Surgical Procedure Performed Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An indication as to whether the participant has had certain gynecologic surgery in the past.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Personal Medical History Gynecologic Surgical Procedure Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies._Of or relating to or practicing gynecology; pertaining to the health issues of women._A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

Property.preferredDefinition: Of or relating to or practicing gynecology; pertaining to the health issues of women.:A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.:Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: Of or relating to or practicing gynecology; pertaining to the health issues of women.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An indication as to whether the participant has had certain gynecologic surgery in the past.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure to remove the uterine body (partial hysterectomy) or the uterine body and cervix (total hysterectomy).

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure to remove the uterine body (partial hysterectomy) or the uterine body and cervix (total hysterectomy).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: A surgical procedure to remove the uterine body (partial hysterectomy) or the uterine body and cervix (total hysterectomy).: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: The surgical removal of one or both ovaries.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
A surgical procedure to remove the uterine body (partial hysterectomy) or the uterine body and cervix (total hysterectomy).
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Partial or complete removal of one or both of the ovaries.
